translated: Points of Controversy🔽The Fifty on Latent Tendencies🔽Eleventh Section

original: Ñāṇakathā🔽Aññāṇe vigate ñāṇavippayutte citte vattamāne na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: ñāṇa kathā  aññāṇe vigate ñāṇa vippayutte citte vattamāne na vattabba
translated: Points of Controversy🔽The Fifty on Latent Tendencies🔽11. The section on knowledge🔽Knowledge
“When ignorance has ended and the mind is free from ignorance, is it to be said that he is one who knows?
“Yes.
“When passion has ended, is it to be said that he is free from passion?

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽aññāṇe vigate ñāṇavippayutte citte vattamāne na vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  aññāṇe vigate ñāṇa vippayutte citte vattamāne na vattabba
translated: “No, that is not the way to put it.
“When ignorance has ended and the mind is free from ignorance, is it to be said that he is one who knows?
“Yes.🔽“When hatred has ended …

analyzed: mohe vigate  kilese vigate na vattabba
translated: “When delusion has ended …
“When defilements have ended, is it to be said that he is free from defilements?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  rāge vigate
translated: “No, that is not the way to put it.
“When passion has ended, is it to be said that he is free from passion?

original: Āmantā.🔽Aññāṇe vigate ñāṇavippayutte citte vattamāne vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: āmantā  aññāṇe vigate ñāṇa vippayutte citte vattamāne
translated: “Yes.
“When ignorance has ended and the mind is free from ignorance, is it to be said that he is one who knows?

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  dose vigate
translated: “No, that is not the way to put it.🔽“When hatred has ended …
“When delusion has ended …
“When defilements have ended, is it to be said that he is free from defilements?

original: Āmantā.🔽Aññāṇe vigate ñāṇavippayutte citte vattamāne vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: āmantā  aññāṇe vigate ñāṇa vippayutte citte vattamāne
translated: “Yes.
“When ignorance has ended and the mind is free from ignorance, is it to be said that he is one who knows?
“No, that is not the way to put it.

original: Aññāṇe vigate ñāṇavippayutte citte vattamāne vattabbaṁ—
analyzed: aññāṇe vigate ñāṇa vippayutte citte vattamāne
translated: When ignorance has gone and a mind not associated with knowledge is occurring, is it proper to say:
‘One who knows’?
‘Yes.’

original: Atītena ñāṇena ñāṇī niruddhena vigatena paṭipassaddhena ñāṇena ñāṇīti?
analyzed: atītena ñāṇena ñāṇī niruddhena vigatena paṭipassaddhena ñāṇena ñāṇī iti
translated: ‘Is one who knows through past knowledge, which has ceased and ended, one who knows’?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
The Discussion of Knowledge is finished.
